org.antkar.syn

Class TextPos

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.antkar.syn.TextPos

  • public final class TextPos
extends java.lang.Object
    A position in an input text. Possible modes are:
    1. Normal. Contains an input descriptor, an offset, line, column and the length of a segment. Abstract Syntax Tree generated by the parser contains only this kind of input positions.
    2. Point. Same as Normal, except the length is 0. Describes a point in the input. Used for errors signaling.
    3. Resource. Contains only an input descriptor. Used for errors signaling when an error is not associated with a particular position in a text.
    4. Undefined, or Null. Never returned by the library, but may be useful for a client code.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static TextPos NULL
      Null, or undefined, position.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextPos(SourceDescriptor source)
      Constructs a position describing an entire input, without a specific position in it.
      TextPos(SourceDescriptor source, int offset, int line, int column, int length)
      Constructs a position with all the parameters known.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getColumn()
      Returns the column number, starting with 1.
      int getLength()
      Returns the length, in characters, of the segment pointed by this position; a length can be 0 if the position describes a point, not a segment.
      int getLine()
      Returns the line number, starting with 1.
      int getOffset()
      Returns the offset of the position in the input, starting with 0.
      SourceDescriptor getSource()
      Returns the source descriptor describing the resource where this position points to.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this position including all known parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextPos

        public TextPos(SourceDescriptor source)
        Constructs a position describing an entire input, without a specific position in it. May be useful for some errors reporting.
        Parameters:
        source - the descriptor of the input. Cannot be null.

      • TextPos

        public TextPos(SourceDescriptor source,
               int offset,
               int line,
               int column,
               int length)
        Constructs a position with all the parameters known.
        Parameters:
        source - the source descriptor. Cannot be null.
        offset - the input offset.
        line - the line number.
        column - the column number.
        length - the segment length.

    • Method Detail

      • getSource

        public SourceDescriptor getSource()
        Returns the source descriptor describing the resource where this position points to.
        Returns:
        the source descriptor, or null for an undefined position.

      • getOffset

        public int getOffset()
        Returns the offset of the position in the input, starting with 0.
        Returns:
        the offset, or -1 if the offset is undefined.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns the length, in characters, of the segment pointed by this position; a length can be 0 if the position describes a point, not a segment.
        Returns:
        the length, or -1 if the exact position is undefined.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this position including all known parameters. Returns "?" if the position is undefined.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
